title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0223

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Catherine, and today we have a very descriptive lesson for you.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一节非常详细的课程。

segments.en: We have an elementary lesson for everyone, and we are going to talk about facial hair.
segments.cn: 我们有一节初级课程，今天要谈论面部毛发。

segments.en: Okay, so Marco, you don't have any facial hair.
Well, I like to shave every other day.
segments.cn: 嗯，我喜欢每隔一天刮一次胡子。

segments.en: But yeah, that's what facial hair is.
It's hair that you have on your face.
Okay, so we're at the police station in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在这个对话中是在警察局。

segments.en: Let's take a listen and find out why.
segments.cn: 让我们听听，看看为什么。

segments.en: Okay, Sally, we have an artist here to help us.
segments.cn: 好的，Sally，我们有一位艺术家来帮助我们。

segments.en: We'll ask you questions about the bank robber you saw, and Paul will draw a picture.
segments.cn: 我们会问你关于你看到的银行抢劫犯的问题，Paul会画一幅画。

segments.en: Well, he had brown hair, long hair, and he had some facial hair.
segments.cn: 他有棕色的长发，还有一些面部毛发。

segments.en: Was it a beard or a mustache?
His mustache was very short and thin, just on the top of his lip.
segments.cn: 他的胡子很短很细，就在上唇上方。

segments.en: I mean, it didn't cover his whole face.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它没有覆盖他的整个脸。

segments.en: I think it was just on his chin.
segments.cn: 我觉得它只是长在他的下巴上。

segments.en: They were long and thick, like yours.
Was this the man you saw?
segments.cn: 这是你看到的那个人吗？

segments.en: He looks a lot like you.
Paul, where were you on Friday afternoon?
I was over there doing the best man.
So, as you can see, the woman is describing a bank robber.
segments.cn: 如你所见，女人在描述一个银行抢劫犯。

segments.en: And one of the ways that she's describing him is by the facial hair that he had.
segments.cn: 她描述他的方式之一是通过他的面部毛发。

segments.en: So, there are a lot of very interesting words and phrases here.
segments.cn: 所以，这里有很多非常有趣的单词和短语。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at some of them in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不在语言收获中看看一些呢？

segments.en: Okay, so in Language Takeaway today, we have some really good description words and nouns.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的语言收获中，我们有一些非常好的描述词和名词。

segments.en: Things that people have on their face.
Because there's not just one kind of facial hair.
segments.cn: 因为面部毛发不止一种。

segments.en: So, our first one is... are we gonna skip facial hair?
segments.cn: 所以，我们的第一个是... 我们要跳过面部毛发吗？
我们的第一个是小胡子。

segments.en: And this is, I think, one of the more popular forms of facial hair.
segments.cn: 我认为这是面部毛发中比较流行的一种。

segments.en: I think it's a style, right?
segments.cn: 我认为这是一种风格，对吧？

segments.en: All these styles of facial hair.
segments.cn: 所有这些面部毛发的风格。

segments.en: And so, a mustache is basically some hair on top of your lip.
segments.cn: 所以，小胡子基本上是你上唇上的一些毛发。

segments.en: And it's usually... it can be thin or thick.
segments.cn: 通常... 它可以是细的或厚的。

segments.en: It comes in different sizes, but this is not your whole face.
segments.cn: 它有不同的大小，但这不是你整个脸。

segments.en: Alright, so for example, a famous person or a famous mustache was Charlie Chaplin, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，例如，一个著名的人或著名的小胡子是查理·卓别林，对吧？
查理·卓别林有一个小胡子。

segments.en: Just a little bit of hair above his lip.
segments.cn: 只是他唇上方的一点毛发。

segments.en: But also, Theodore Roosevelt had a very big bushy mustache.
segments.cn: 但西奥多·罗斯福也有一个非常大的浓密小胡子。

segments.en: Interesting fact, you might hear someone say stache instead of mustache.
segments.cn: 有趣的事实，你可能会听到有人说stache而不是小胡子。

segments.en: This is a short way to say it.
So, oh, he's growing a stache.
Right, and also the spelling can be a little bit difficult to understand how you pronounce it because it's M-U-S-T-A-C-H-E.
segments.cn: 对，拼写也可能有点难以理解，因为它是M-U-S-T-A-C-H-E。

segments.en: So, there's no really SH sound like sh, but you pronounce it mustache.
segments.cn: 所以，没有真正的SH音，但你发音为mustache。

segments.en: So, that's one kind of facial hair, but there are many others.
segments.cn: 所以，这是一种面部毛发，但还有很多其他种类。

segments.en: The next one we've got for you is a beard.
segments.cn: 我们为你准备的下一个是胡子。

segments.en: Okay, this is a really good one.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一个非常好的。

segments.en: I think a beard keeps men warm.
segments.cn: 我认为胡子能让男人在冬天保持温暖。

segments.en: I think a beard keeps a man warm in the winter.
segments.cn: 我认为胡子能让一个人在冬天保持温暖。

segments.en: So, basically, a beard, you have hair on your lip and also all over your face, basically.
segments.cn: 所以，基本上，胡子是你唇上的毛发，还有你脸上的毛发，基本上。

segments.en: So, a beard you have all over your face.
segments.cn: 所以，胡子是你脸上的毛发。

segments.en: Right, your cheeks, your chin, and above your lip.
segments.cn: 对，你的脸颊、下巴和上唇。

segments.en: So, a famous person with a beard?
Santa Claus has a very big beard.
segments.cn: 圣诞老人有一个非常大的胡子。

segments.en: Yeah, Santa Claus has a big beard, big white beard.
segments.cn: 是的，圣诞老人有一个大胡子，大白胡子。

segments.en: I think that's the easiest to have because you don't need to cut anything or shave anything.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是最简单的，因为你不需要剪或刮任何东西。

segments.en: If you don't trim, it looks kind of bad.
segments.cn: 如果不修剪，看起来有点糟糕。

segments.en: Well, now, moving on to our next style of facial hair, we have a goatee.
segments.cn: 现在，接下来我们要谈的是另一种面部毛发风格，我们有山羊胡。

segments.en: Okay, this might be confusing for some people because it's not a beard and it's not a mustache.
segments.cn: 好的，这对某些人来说可能会困惑，因为这不是胡子，也不是小胡子。

segments.en: It's basically hair around your mouth.
segments.cn: 基本上是嘴周围的毛发。

segments.en: On your chin and your lip.
So, I think Sean Connery has a very famous goatee.
segments.cn: 我觉得肖恩·康纳利有一个非常著名的山羊胡。

segments.en: And Brad Pitt right now has a really big goatee.
segments.cn: 现在布拉德·皮特有一个非常大的山羊胡。

segments.en: Or a long goatee, lots of hair.
segments.cn: 或者一个长山羊胡，很多毛发。

segments.en: So, as you say, it's around your mouth, so your lip and your chin.
segments.cn: 所以，正如你所说，它在嘴周围，所以在嘴唇和下巴上。

segments.en: Okay, so that's our third style of facial hair.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们的第三种面部毛发风格。

segments.en: And now, moving on to our last style, we have sideburns.
segments.cn: 现在，接下来是我们的最后一种风格，我们有鬓角。

segments.en: Okay, so think about the word here.
So, near the ears, there is usually some space where a man can grow some hair.
segments.cn: 所以，在耳朵附近，通常有一些空间可以让男人长出毛发。

segments.en: Not with a beard or necessarily a mustache, though.
segments.cn: 但不一定是胡子或小胡子。

segments.en: It can be just the hair on the jawline, near the jaw, near the ears.
segments.cn: 可能只是下颌线附近的毛发，靠近下巴，靠近耳朵。

segments.en: So, I think this was a very famous style in the 60s and 70s.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是60年代和70年代非常流行的风格。

segments.en: You would have long sideburns all along your face.
And the longer, maybe the sexier you were.
No, but these days, it's not as popular, but you do see people who have sideburns.
segments.cn: 不过，现在这种风格不那么流行，但你确实会看到有鬓角的人。

segments.en: I think nowadays, people have sideburns, but they're not as thick.
segments.cn: 我觉得现在人们有鬓角，但没有那么厚。

segments.en: They're just like thin little sideburns.
All right, so all of these are the different sorts and styles of facial hair.
segments.cn: 好吧，这些都是不同种类和风格的面部毛发。

segments.en: Of course, there are a lot more.
I think while we were looking for this on the Internet, we found a lot of other styles that came up like mutton chops and things like this.
segments.cn: 我觉得当我们在网上寻找这些时，我们发现了很多其他风格，比如羊角胡之类的。

segments.en: But these are probably the most popular ones.
segments.cn: 但这些可能是最流行的。

segments.en: These are the ones you're going to hear about the most.
So, why don't we go back, listen to our dialogue again, and we'll go back.
segments.cn: 那么，我们为什么不回去，再听一遍我们的对话，然后再回去。

segments.en: Okay, Sally, we have an artist here to help us.
segments.cn: 好的，萨莉，我们这里有一位艺术家来帮助我们。

segments.en: We'll ask you questions about the bank robber you saw and Paul will draw a picture.
segments.cn: 我们会问你关于你看到的银行抢劫犯的问题，保罗会画一幅画。

segments.en: Well, he had brown hair, long hair, and he had some facial hair.
segments.cn: 他有棕色的长发，还有一些面部毛发。
面部毛发，是胡子还是小胡子？

segments.en: The facial hair, was it a beard or a mustache?

segments.cn: 他的胡子非常短而细，只在嘴唇上方。

segments.en: His mustache was very short and thin, just on the top of his lip.

segments.cn: 这是小胡子，但胡子不对。

segments.en: That's the mustache, but the beard isn't right.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它没有覆盖他的整个脸。

segments.en: I mean, it didn't cover his whole face.
segments.cn: 我觉得它只是下巴上的。

segments.en: I think it was just on his chin.
They were long and thick, like yours.
Was this the man you saw?
segments.cn: 这是你看到的那个人吗？

segments.en: It looks a lot like you.
Paul, where were you on Friday afternoon?
segments.cn: 保罗，你星期五下午在哪里？

segments.en: I was over there doing the thing.
So today in Fluency Builder, we are not really talking about phrases as much as talking about adjectives, so words you can use to describe facial hair.
segments.cn: 所以今天在流利表达中，我们并不是在谈短语，而是在谈形容词，所以你可以用来描述面部毛发的词。

segments.en: So when the girl was describing facial hair, for example, she said the mustache was very short and thin.
segments.cn: 所以当女孩描述面部毛发时，例如，她说小胡子非常短而细。

segments.en: So you think about it, you can have a very thick mustache.
segments.cn: 所以你想想，你可以有一根非常厚的小胡子。

segments.en: That means very hairy, very wide.
segments.cn: 这意味着非常多毛，非常宽。

segments.en: A thin mustache is like a line.
So for example, Charlie Chaplin, he had a short mustache, but it wasn't thin.
segments.cn: 例如，查理·卓别林，他有一个短胡子，但并不细。

segments.en: It was a little bit thick.
But you think of, you know, when you see someone who's drawing a mustache on a sign at a restaurant or in a newspaper, that's usually very thin.
segments.cn: 但你想想，当你看到有人在餐馆的标志或报纸上画胡子时，通常是非常细的。

segments.en: So those are different adjectives to describe, not only a mustache.
segments.cn: 所以这些是描述面部毛发的不同形容词。

segments.en: So basically we can use these to describe any sort of hair.
segments.cn: 基本上我们可以用这些来描述任何类型的毛发。

segments.en: For example, the hair on your head.
You can say he's got short hair.
Or I could say I have long hair.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说我有长发。

segments.en: Or Mark, I could say you have thick hair.
segments.cn: 或者马克，我可以说你有浓密的头发。

segments.en: So if you have an abundance of hair that you would say it's thick.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有很多头发，你可以说它是浓密的。

segments.en: There's a, you know, it's like if you put your hand in it, it's very, it feels like there's a lot that's very thick hair.
segments.cn: 就是说，如果你把手放进去，感觉有很多，非常浓密的头发。

segments.en: Some people have thin hair, so they don't have a lot of hair.
segments.cn: 有些人有细发，所以他们的头发不多。

segments.en: And well, moving on to the parts of the face.
segments.cn: 那么，继续谈论面部的部分。

segments.en: We described it before as to where a mustache is, where a goatee is.
segments.cn: 我们之前描述了胡子的位置，山羊胡的位置。

segments.en: But let's take a closer look at that.
For example, a mustache is on your upper lip.
segments.cn: 例如，胡子在你的上唇上。

segments.en: So just above your lip, under your nose, that's where a mustache goes.
segments.cn: 所以就在你的嘴唇上方，鼻子下方，那就是胡子的位置。

segments.en: But if we're talking about a goatee, it's not just on your upper lip.
segments.cn: 但如果我们谈论山羊胡，它不仅仅在你的上唇上。

segments.en: So that's the very bottom point of your face.
segments.cn: 所以那是你脸的最底部。

segments.en: So you have your chin, your upper lip, and also when we talked about, for example, the sideburns, we talked about the jaw, but also it could be part of the cheek.
segments.cn: 所以你有下巴，上唇，还有当我们谈论例如鬓角时，我们谈论下颌，但也可以是脸颊的一部分。

segments.en: So every person has two cheeks, one on the left and one on the right, and those are a very big part of your face on the sides of your nose.
segments.cn: 所以每个人都有两颊，一个在左边，一个在右边，那是你脸的一个很大部分，在鼻子的两侧。

segments.en: So you have your chin, you have your cheeks, you have your upper lip.
segments.cn: 所以你有下巴，你有脸颊，你有上唇。

segments.en: I think that's pretty much the only places where you can grow also on your neck.
segments.cn: 我认为这基本上是你可以长毛发的唯一地方，还有在你的脖子上。

segments.en: Some people have it on their neck or on the back of...
segments.cn: 有些人脖子上或后面有。

segments.en: Some people also have it on their neck.
So a lot of different words to describe facial hair.
segments.cn: 所以有很多不同的词来描述面部毛发。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue one last time, and we'll be back to talk some more.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一遍对话，然后我们会回来再谈。

segments.en: Okay, Sally, we have an artist here to help us.
segments.cn: 好的，萨莉，我们有一位艺术家来帮助我们。

segments.en: We'll ask you questions about the bank robber you saw and Paul will draw a picture.
segments.cn: 我们会问你关于你看到的银行抢劫犯的问题，保罗会画一幅画。

segments.en: Well, he had brown hair, long hair, and he had some facial hair.
segments.cn: 嗯，他有棕色的长发，还有一些面部毛发。

segments.en: The facial hair, was it a beard or a mustache?
segments.cn: 面部毛发，是胡子还是胡须？

segments.en: His mustache was very short and thin, just on the top of his lip.
segments.cn: 他的胡子非常短且细，就在他的上唇上。

segments.en: Yes, that's the mustache, but the beard isn't right.
segments.cn: 是的，那是胡子，但胡须不对。

segments.en: I mean, it didn't cover his whole face.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，它没有覆盖他的整个脸。

segments.en: I think it was just on his chin.
segments.cn: 我认为它只在他的下巴上。

segments.en: Um, yes, they were long and thick, like yours.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，它们又长又厚，像你的。

segments.en: Was this the man you saw?
segments.cn: 这是你看到的那个人吗？

segments.en: It looks a lot like you.
Paul, where were you on Friday afternoon?
segments.cn: 保罗，你星期五下午在哪里？

segments.en: I was over there doing the thing with the best man.
segments.cn: 我在那边和伴郎一起做事情。

segments.en: So talking about facial hair, Catherine, do you like men that have facial hair?
segments.cn: 所以说到胡须，凯瑟琳，你喜欢有胡须的男人吗？
你喜欢胡子、胡须、山羊胡吗？

segments.en: But sometimes people don't do them correctly, so I don't like them.
segments.cn: 但有时人们做得不对，所以我不喜欢。

segments.en: What is it about facial hair on men that you like?
segments.cn: 你喜欢男人的面部毛发什么呢？

segments.en: There's something, you know, kind of rough about it.
segments.cn: 有些东西，你知道，有点粗糙。

segments.en: I don't like the very manicured, very carefully cut facial hair.
segments.cn: 我不喜欢那种修剪得非常整齐的面部毛发。

segments.en: I kind of like it a little bit more on the rough side.
segments.cn: 我更喜欢那种稍微粗糙一点的。

segments.en: It's interesting because it's interesting to see also facial hair on long facial hair.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为看到长面部毛发也很有趣。

segments.en: Like, for example, the guys from ZZ Top.
You know, they have like really long beards.
segments.cn: 你知道，他们有非常长的胡须。

segments.en: I wonder how long it takes to grow something like this.
segments.cn: 我想知道长这样的东西需要多长时间。

segments.en: I'm sure we could find out on the Internet.
segments.cn: 我相信我们可以在网上找到答案。

segments.en: But yeah, no, they have competitions.
There's a world mustache competition, for example, and they have the world's longest mustache.
segments.cn: 比如说，有世界胡子比赛，他们有世界上最长的胡子。

segments.en: It's three or four meters or something.
So I think your hair keeps growing.
segments.cn: 所以我认为你的毛发会继续生长。

segments.en: It just depends on when you decide to cut it.
segments.cn: 这只是取决于你决定什么时候剪。

segments.en: I think it's also a very cultural thing, right?
segments.cn: 我认为这也是一种文化现象，对吧？

segments.en: Some cultures are able to grow a lot of facial hair and like to do it.
segments.cn: 一些文化能够长出很多面部毛发并喜欢这样做。

segments.en: For example, you don't really see many Asians with facial hair, with goatees or mustaches.
segments.cn: 例如，你很少看到亚洲人有面部毛发，山羊胡或胡子。

segments.en: I think you see more goatees than you see full beards, actually.
segments.cn: 我认为你看到的山羊胡比全胡子多。

segments.en: Although India, you see a little bit more facial hair.
segments.cn: 虽然在印度，你会看到更多的面部毛发。

segments.en: So this is an interesting question.
segments.cn: 所以这是个有趣的问题。

segments.en: Tell us how popular it is in your country.
segments.cn: 告诉我们在你们国家的流行程度。

segments.en: Or if you like men with facial hair, or if you're a guy, do you like to have a beard, a mustache, or a goatee?
segments.cn: 或者如果你喜欢有面部毛发的男人，或者如果你是个男孩，你喜欢留胡子、胡子还是山羊胡？

segments.en: So come to our website, EnglishPod.com, and we'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 所以来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，我们在那里见。
